text: [Music] [Applause] [Music]

hi I'm Josh a technical customer support specialist
here at the AWS office in Seattle today I'll

show you how to remove a member account from
a Consolidated bill in AWS organizations let's

get started as your organization needs change
you might find that certain accounts in your

organization are no longer needed for example
perhaps you want them to have their own Standalone

account and billing so that they don't appear
on your Consolidated bill for AWS charges

by default the management account of the organization
is responsible for the billing this means

charges for all member accounts are rolled
up to the management account let's see how

to remove this account from a Consolidated
bill first you must log into the AWS management

account of the organization to proceed with
the next steps of removing an account from

your organization you must be sure that you're
logged into the management account either

as the AWS account root user an IAM user with
admin permissions or an IAM user with appropriate

organization permissions when you are on the
AWS Management console page navigate to AWS

organizations console you can do this by entering
organizations in the search bar you can choose

the account drop down and click on organization
or if you've already visited this page it

appears in the recently visited section now
we're in the AWS organizations console here

you'll see a list of accounts a search bar
to find a particular account and a button

to add an AWS account to the organization
before an account can leave the organization

it must be able to operate as a standalone
account this requires an AWS support plan

verified contact information and a valid payment
method when an account is removed from a Consolidated

Bill the member account is liable for any
charges for billable AWS activity that occurs

when an account is no longer attached to the
organization after you take care of these

steps you're ready to remove the account from
the organization choose the box next to the

account that you want to remove click the
actions drop down list and select remove from

organization a confirmation window appears
be sure that everything looks correct and

then choose remove account if the action is
unsuccessful then the confirmation window

stays open and shows a red box with an error
message containing the piece of the puzzle

that's missing for the account to be a standalone
account

after you remedy the issue you can choose
the retry remove button if this action is

successful the confirmation window closes
and you'll see a green Banner on the top of

the screen showing that the account was removed
successfully member accounts can also leave

an organization themselves to do this you'll
follow the same steps logging into the member

account and navigating to the organization's
console but instead you'll choose to leave

this organization button a confirmation window
appears and you'll choose leave organization

and now you know how to remove a member account
from a Consolidated bill in AWS organizations

thanks for watching and happy cloud computing
from all of us here at AWS [Music] [Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
